title: Randy Quaid detained in Vermont trying to cross border
text:

Check out this story on wtsp.com: http://on.wtsp.com/1Lo1kFF Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Randy Quaid detained in Vermont trying to cross border Associated Press, AP 1:52 p.m. EDT October 10, 2015 Actor Randy Quaid is seen being escorted into his Immigration and Refugee Board hearing in Montreal, Thursday. (Photo: Peter McCabe, AP) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
HIGHGATE, Vt. (AP) — Actor Randy Quaid is expected to be arraigned Monday in Vermont on a charge of being a fugitive from justice after police say he was taken into custody while trying to cross into the country from Canada. 
The Independence Day actor was detained by troopers at the Highgate Springs port of entry days after Canadian officials said he would be deported. Quaid is wanted in Santa Barbara, Calif., to face felony vandalism charges filed in 2010 after he and his wife, Evi, were found squatting in a guesthouse of a home they previously owned. 
The pair skipped several court appearances and went to Canada, where Evi Quaid was granted citizenship. Randy Quaid’s bid to gain permanent residency was denied. "Independence Day" actor Randy Quaid is in police custody after trying to cross into the U.S. from Canada. Quaid and his wife are wanted in Santa Barbara, CA for felony vandalism charges.
